alert.note: Alert for Kemper; Noxubee (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 17 at 4:00PM CST until February 17 at 4:15PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CST FOR SOUTHEASTERN NOXUBEE AND CENTRAL KEMPER COUNTIES... At 400 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located near Bluff Springs, or 7 miles southeast of Preston, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... De Kalb around 405 PM CST. Cooksville around 425 PM CST. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Shuqualak and Scooba. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CST for east central Mississippi. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
